title: Festival of Learning tasters
description:
A selection of free taster workshops involving Creative Writing, Digital Photography, Local History, ICT and Art Appreciation.

My Story - creative writing workshops
My Pictures - creating digital family and friends photo albums 
My Town - Local History - getting to know your town
My Internet - getting on the internet
Poole Painting - A talk about artists who have been inspired by Poole

Further information about dates, times and venues of the above workshops will be available in Poole Libraries, Poole Museum, Poole Adult Learning at Oakdale and the Borough of Poole website.

Registration for the above events will be available at the Libraries, Museum and Poole Adult learning at Oakdale
organisation: Poole Adult Learning, Poole Museum and Poole Libraries

title: The Victorian Way of Death
description:
Death was ever present in nineteenth century life. Not as morbid as it may sound, cultural historian Danny Wells gives us a fascinating glimpse into Victorian attitudes to death.
This talk is a part of Walsall Museum's regular programme of free public talks on local history, family history and social history.  Places are limited so advance booking is essential.

title: Quilt the Museum Red, Blue and Green!
description:
As part of The Big Draw come and help us draw inspiration from the quilts on display in our Nineties Collection exhibition to create our own giant piece of patchwork. The bigger the better! 

Members of Walsall Patchwork & Quilters will be present throughout to demonstrate a range of patchwork quilting techniques. 

Simply drop in at any time between 11am and 3pm to help us make our patchwork.  Free of charge, no need to book.

title: Wacky Witches and Potent Potions!
description:
Family Learning - Learn Together

Somerset Record Office, Taunton, Somerset
Age 3 to 10  £3 per child

Wacky Witches and Potent Potions!
Have a bewitching time this half term with spooky activities for Halloween.

No unaccompanied 'Muggles'!

This activity must be booked and paid for in advance.
To book a place please call: 01823 362847

title: Autumn Animals
description:

title: A' is for Apple
description:
Family Learning - Learning Together

Somerset Rural Life Museum, Glastonbury, Somerset
Age 3 to 12

Free drop-in activity for accompanied children

For more information please ring: 01458 831197
